headline: Coronavirus pandemic tests Southwest Airlines' record of no pay cuts, furloughs
summary: Southwest Airlines is asking unions for concessions to help lower costs and avoid furloughs through 2021.
Snap's VP of Sales for Americas Peter Naylor said that "advertisers do want to get back, and they are getting back into the groove."
headline: As ad market rebounds from coronavirus, Snap says it's 'feeling a lot of momentum'

summary: AMC Theaters, the largest cinema chain in the U.S., and rival Cinemark said they have no plans to shutter theaters even as additional Hollywood blockbusters postpone their release dates to next year.
headline: AMC, Cinemark won't close theaters even as blockbusters flee 2020

summary: The European Court of Justice (ECJ) has ruled that member states cannot collect mass mobile and internet data on citizens.
headline: EU’s top court limits government spying on citizens’ mobile and internet data
Rising levels of pandemic fatigue are being seen in Europe, WHO warns
summary: Rising levels of "Covid-19 fatigue" are being seen in Europe, the regional director of the World Health Organisation warned.

headline: Holiday crowds at the mall will be smaller this year: ShopperTrak predicts as much as 25% drop in shoppers
summary: Black Friday, the day after Thanksgiving, is still expected to be the busiest day in stores and at malls during the 2020 holiday season. But it's losing its clout.
Clover will go public via a merger with Social Capital Hedosophia Holdings Corp. III, a special purpose acquisition company.
headline: Chamath Palihapitiya to take Clover Health public in another SPAC deal worth $3.7 billion
One coffee stock could be about to gain major momentum, trader says
summary: Starbucks is getting a caffeine boost after analysts at Oppenheimer named the stock as an “actionable buy idea” and raised their price target to $101.

headline: Moody's Sees Virus and Oil Shocks Speeding Up Gulf Bank Mergers

summary: The Google Workspace approach, with more obvious pricing options for small and large businesses, could help adoption and spur more growth in Google's cloud business.
headline: Google's competitor to Microsoft Office is being rebranded as Workspace and getting new pricing tiers
30 Asia-based market strategists reveal how they're playing the U.S. election
summary: Stock market analysts in Asia clearly do not agree on who will win the U.S. presidential election. But they're pretty unified on how they plan to play it.

headline: Business leaders see increased hiring in these 3 areas following the coronavirus
summary: Business leaders across a range of industries and countries see increased hiring in three specific areas following the pandemic, according to a new McKinsey report.

headline: Bristol-Myers gets 'potentially revolutionary medicine' in MyoKardia deal, CEO says
summary: "MyoKardia is an important company because they developed a really interesting approach to the treatment of cardiovascular disease," Bristol-Myers Squibb CEO Giovanni Caforio said.
"There's nothing the market hates more than uncertainty — take it away and stocks go higher," the "Mad Money" host said.
headline: 'I think what we got today was the removal of uncertainty,' Jim Cramer says

summary: Apple manufactures a variety of audio products under its Beats brand as well as products such as AirPods wireless earbuds and the HomePod smart speaker under the main Apple brand.
headline: Sonos stock drops on report that Apple is purging third-party audio products from its stores
New information about Facebook's Instagram acquisition delayed House antitrust report, source says
summary: The report is expected to conclude the more than year-long investigation into Apple, Amazon, Facebook and Google, and will suggest potential areas for reform in the antitrust laws.

The lobbying industry, worth more than $3.5 billion, is arguably the U.S. government's oldest profession and is protected by the First Amendment. Yet critics say it undermines the country's democracy by tilting influencing power in the favor of those with unlimited financial resources.
headline: Lobbying in Q1 topped a record $938 million, but lobbyists say their profession is misunderstood
Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Alteryx, Iovance Biotherapeutics & more
summary: Take a look at the companies making headlines in after-hours trading.
The release date of sci-fi epic "Dune" has been delayed until next October, according to Deadline.
headline: 'Dune' release date reportedly pushed back to October 2021

summary: Trump's path to re-election hinges largely on the trajectory of the coronavirus and its impact on the national economy, and he's gotten unsettling news about both lately.
headline: Trump's coronavirus infection and signs of economic weakness pose re-election challenges
